title: How to Create a Gaming Clan

steps.headline: Find a game that you enjoy very much.
Gather some friends who are: trustworthy, dependable, and helpful.
Discuss with your friends on their weak spots and their strong points.
steps.description: Knowing their strengths and weaknesses allows you to assign jobs easier.

steps.headline: Assign jobs and assignments to everyone.
steps.description: examples: clan recruiter(s), site editor, moderator, and admin.

steps.headline: Come up with a group name.
Create some the ranks of your group.
steps.description: You can also name how your ranks to keep them unique.

steps.headline: Set some ground rules.
steps.description: Keep them simple and easy to follow.

steps.headline: Have some way of contact with others in a clan.
steps.description: The best way for this is usually making a website for others to be able to see. This way they can check news updates,tournaments,see what members have joined,post calendars,and receive updates other than on the game. So, making a website would probably be your best bet if you're trying to figure out the best way of group contact.

steps.headline: Give everyone the link and start to recruit others.
steps.description: More people usually means more fun.

steps.headline: Give the new recruits a test.
steps.description: Take one of your best or moderately good players and let the recruit battle them. This way you can rate on how good the recruit is and how good he/she reacted to winning or losing.

steps.headline: Assign ranks to your new members.
steps.description: This way they'll have a sense of really being a part of the group.

steps.headline: Maintain a nice and stable gaming environment.
steps.description: You don't want your members to start arguing or fighting.

steps.headline: Form allies.
steps.description: This way you'll have another group who can help your group when it's not doing so fine.

steps.headline: Keep a healthy relationship with your allies and other groups.
steps.description: This way others will respect you and will be willing to compete against you often)

steps.headline: Use the Golden Rule:  Treat others as you would want to be treated.
steps.description: Make sure that everyone uses this rule, it's important.

Come up with a group name. Make it original. Create some the ranks of your group. You can also name how your ranks to keep them unique. Set some ground rules. Keep them simple and easy to follow. This way you can rate on how good the recruit is and how good he/she reacted to winning or losing. Assign ranks to your new members. This way they'll have a sense of really being a part of the group. Maintain a nice and stable gaming environment. You don't want your members to start arguing or fighting. Form allies.
